intro: Lipandra polysperma, commonly known as the many-seeded lipandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces numerous small fruits, each containing multiple seeds, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
